body.p: In their comment letters on the exposure draft, some respondents expressed concerns that the wording of the amendment was too open‑ended and could lead to structuring risks. Mr Smith believes that these concerns are well‑founded because there is no limitation on what qualifies as a class of equity. Without some limitation, an entity could, for example, establish a foreign currency trading subsidiary, issue shares to a non‑controlling interest and deem the shares to be a class of equity in the consolidated group.
